N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7010.1 - Policy

State Regulations
(a) In order to
provide adequate medical care for incarcerated persons, the chief
administrative officer of each local correctional facility shall develop and
implement written policies and procedures consistent with this Part. (b) Prompt screening is essential to identify
serious or life-threatening medical conditions requiring immediate evaluation
and treatment. Appropriate medical appraisal of inmates is necessary to reduce
the risk that a serious physical deficiency or medical emergency will be
obscured by drug or alcohol ingestion. Notes
